title: update from 5.03 to 5.0.4 throws error because of non-relevant table in database
body:
### expected behaviour
smooth upgrade of clean (with only the admin-user) 5.0.3 installation to 5.0.4

### actual behaviour
turned on maintenance mode
failed to get existing database structure for updating (mdb2_schema error: schema validation error, there was already an primary index or autoincrement field in "ow_base_question_account_type" before "primary")

### steps to reproduce
1. have my database
2. install oc 5.0.3
3. update to 5.0.4

### server configuration
operating system: ubuntu 12.04 2 (64)

web server: apache/2.2.22

database: mysql ver 14.14 distrib 5.5.29, for debian-linux-gnu (x86_64) using readline 6.2

php version: php 5.3.10-1ubuntu3.6 with suhosin-patc

owncloud version: 5.0.4


#### owncloud log (data/owncloud.log)
```
    {"app":"php","message":"non-static method mdb2_schema::errormessage() should not be called statically, assuming $this from incompatible context at \/var\/www\/...\/...\/3rdparty\/mdb2\/schema.php#2794","level":2,"time":1365703262}
    {"app":"core","message":"failed to get existing database structure for updating (mdb2_schema error: schema validation error, there was already an primary index or autoincrement field in \"ow_base_question_account_type\" before \"primary\")","level":4,"time":1365703262}

##############
what's special here is that the (mysql) tables was also newly created for the 5.0.3, with default (hardcoded -why?) oc_ prefix. (look at the error in the log. it refers to a table with ow_.)

i solved the problem by moving owncloud to it's own database, but i'm still curious about how this can happen.
